data.content:
adjective
always used before a noun
US informal
involving, making, or spending a small amount of money
nickel-and-dime charges/fees
nickel-and-dime tax increases
nickel-and-dime customers/tourists
not very important
nickel-and-dime [=small-time] businesses
nickel-and-dime candidates
verb
nickels-and-dimes or nickel-and-dimes; nickeled-and-dimed or nickel-and-dimed; nickeling-and-diming or nickel-and-diming
[+ obj] US informal + disapproving :to make (someone) pay many small amounts of money over a long period of time
Customers are being nickeled-and-dimed by the cell phone company. [=customers are being charged extra small fees by the cell phone company that will add up to a lot of money over time]
You should buy a new car before this one nickle-and-dimes you to death. [=before you need to pay for a lot of repairs on this one]
